With H3, I did have the issue of running out of disk space due to the .del =
files during the crawl itself.

If I remember correctly, there is a configu=
ration for no keeping them/deleting them within the database configuration =
but it is not possible to change it.

I created a croned script to removed =
them. It Works fine but that's not really 'clean'.

--- In archive-crawler@=
yahoogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> Unless you're using ch=
eckpoints, you can always delete the .DEL files. 
> (If using checkpointing=
, make sure to retain the .DEL files representing 
> .JDB files referenced =
by the checkpoints you might want to resume from 
> -- perhaps just the las=
t checkpoint.)
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
> 
> On 12/12/10 11:13 PM, Mahmoud Mubara=
k wrote:
> >
> > I have a concern for growing disk usage on my job's direct=
ory, and I am
> > worried the crawl would stall due to the file system runn=
ing out of
> > space. Would it be a good idea to get rid of the .del files =
under the
> > state directory while the crawl is running, or would it be be=
tter to
> > take a different approach?
> >
> > Thanks in advance.
> >
>
